question: What is the lead time?
answer:
Depending on the nature of the print
1) Silkscreen Printing orders will take 10 days or less.
2) Embroidery & Digital Printing orders will take 14 days or less.

We accept rush orders as well. Depending on complexity, we can complete within 2-5 days.

question: What is the minimum quantity of order?
answer: No minimum quantity. However, it is depends on the nature of design.

question: What are the payment methods?
answer:
1) Bank Transfer
2) Cheque
3) Payment at our Office location
4) GeBiz or E-invoice via Vendors.gov.sg

question: What are the payment terms?
answer:
50% deposit payment can be made through bank transfer or cheque. Cash deposit is accepted at our location. 50% balance payment upon receipt of goods.

 For Corporate Companies, we accept Purchase Order Invoices. Cheque / Cash presented upon delivery of goods.

 We also accept Government instituition through GeBiz or E-invoice.

question: What printing colours are available?
answer:
For Silkscreen Printing, you may choose a pantone colour code of your preference. Do take note colour variation on computer screen may differ from end result printing colour.  This is due to the difference in brightness and contrast settings for each screen.

 For Heat Transfer Vinyl, please contact our staff for more information on availability of colours. Colours are subjected to availability.

question: Which printing method is the most durable?
answer:
In terms of ranking
1) Embroidery
2) Silkscreen Printing
3) Digital Heat Transfer / Vinyl Transfer Printing

question: Can I provide my own shirts to print?
answer: Yes. However, it is required that we first check if the material is able to be printed on.

question: How much is the cost per shirt ?
answer:
It varies according to these factors
1) Quantity
2) Printing Location (Eg. Front / Back / Sleeve)
3) Design (According to number of colours)
4) Dimension of Design

question: Can I request for a physical sample ?
answer:
Yes, only one physical sample is provided for orders of 1000 pieces and above.

For fewer orders, TJG will provide a copy of digital artwork before order confirmation.

TJG welcome customers to view sample materials or apparel we have at our office.

question: Are the white shirts sheer?
answer: Generally, white shirts are sheer and translucent. We advise customers who are concerned about the sheerness of white shirts to swap to other dull coloured shirts or view sample materials at our office. Please ensure you address any questions or issues regarding white shirt orders beforehand. We will not be held responsible once orders are processed.

question: Garment Manufacturing Flaws
answer: We are not responsible for apparel inconsistencies related to shade of colour, sizes and quality. As garments are produced in large different batches, one batch may differ from another.

question: Stock Balance
answer: Stock availability are subjected to final stock count upon paid deposit. We will not be held liable for delays due to garments which are out of stock or discontinued apparels.

question: Return & Exchange Policy
answer:
Upon receipt of goods, we only allow a maximum of 2 days to sound off for any defects. If a request for reprint is met by TJG, the customer must return the defected goods in the original condition.

Following conditions:

1) Manufacturing defects (Eg.Holes)
2) Printing Error due to our neglience
3) Wrong Apparel/Size/Colour  (Proof of original purchase to be shown)


We will not be held responsible for any conditions :

1) Wrong Apparel/Size/Colour due to Customer's neglience
2) Change of mind
3) Tone/Shade of Apparel colour are different
4) Printing Colour, Apparel Material & Quality not to customer's expectation
6) Wear & Tear due to customer's neglience

question: Reprint Policy
answer:
Generally, repeat orders pricing follows :
1-4 pieces ($3 more each)
5-9 pieces ($2 more each)
For quantities of above 10 pricing, will be quoted accordingly
*Design are only kept for 3 months*
Please contact us to know the exact charges. Pricing are subjected to changes.

question: Font Usage
answer:
Please specify and provide fonts for your respective designs.
For customize names or numbers. Please do not select fonts that are cracked, sketchy, faded or too thin.
It is the customer's responsibility to check and choose the correct font (Eg. Upper casing / Lower casing) ; Some font comes only in uppercasing. TJG will follow accordingly to the customize list provided and will not be held responsible for any error.

question: Artwork Approval
answer: Digital artwork will be submitted for customer approval. It is the customer's responsibility to verify that all information and details are correct. This includes checking for spelling, artwork dimensions and design. No further amendments can be made after confirmation of artwork proposal. TJG will not be held liable for any cost associated with reprinting or setting up new design.
